Merge pull request #92 from mattflaschen/pull_request_ie_user_agent

Fix IE regex literal to handle IE 10.

First commit of the dev branch and beginning of version 2.0.0! Changelog:
- Started keeping a changelog in changelog.txt.
- Since this is a major change, I am incrementing the version number to 2.0.0. (Following Semantic Versioning, http://semver.org/)
- Created a dev branch on GitHub. (https://github.com/jeff-optimizely/Guiders-JS/tree/dev) Contributors, issue pull requests to the dev branch so I can safely pull them without worrying about screwing up master code.
- Changed the file names from guiders-(version).js and guiders-(version).css to simply guiders.js and guiders.css, so that it's easier to track changes in GitHub. If you want to know what version you have, just open the file or check guiders.version.
- Upgraded jQuery from 1.51 to 1.90. It should still work with older versions of jQuery.
- Use var guiders = this.guiders = {}; instead of var guiders = (function() { ... }) in order for guiders to attach to the window object more reliably. (Thanks @spmason https://github.com/spmason/Guiders-JS/commit/7229f66870701b980e98d80d1ac79cbb0016b92d#commitcomment-2506855)
- Added bower support in component.json (Thanks rajkissu https://github.com/jeff-optimizely/Guiders-JS/pull/78)
- Added a method: guiders.getCurrentGuider, to get the current guider. This can be useful for analytics tracking, for example.
- guiders.next and guiders.prev return the value of guiders.getCurrent()
- Allow creating guidres in the HTML, then creating guiders via $("#guider2").guider(options).  The options can be passed in through options or set as data-attrs on the object in the HTML. (Thanks @tarr11 https://github.com/jeff-optimizely/Guiders-JS/issues/85)

Merge pull request #48 from wachunga/master

Bug: hideAll() with no guiders caused script error
Add highlight class.
Add class for highlight element instead of add css rule (z-index). It`s must be more flexible.

Fixes an issue were the jQueryized version of the attachTo was being leaked back to the main version of the object.
This caused issues if the attachTo element was not initially on the page when the guider
was created, but later was added to the page. Because this code was originally replacing
the guider.attachTo with the jQuery version (which is empty for non-existent elements)
if you later added the element to the page, the guider had nothing to attach to.
Adds an onHide method (to complement the onShow method) and move the onShow method to before _attach is called so that it can be used for repositioning page elements
Fix for removing empty button container when there is no buttons.
Fixed position of check if buttons are defined and added return
Remove title and buttons container if the respective options are not defined or empty.

Fix for TypeError being thrown when position is set, but no attachTo element is defined.
change to check for visibility instead of being in the DOM
skip guider if attachTo is not present on the page

Adding highlight option to README

Added a "highlight" option that takes an element selector.  If a guider has the overlay option and highlight option, it will "highlight" an element by setting the z-index to be > than the overlay.  Make sure the element you are highlighting has position: relative.

Merge pull request #26 from AD7six/patch-1

Don't trigger a js error if the attachTo selector finds nothing.

Don't trigger a js error if the attachTo selector finds nothing.

If e.g. attachTo is #notonthepageyet you'll see:

    `Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null`

This simple change prevents that.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master'

Conflicts:
	guiders-1.1.0.css
Added a couple links to live examples of Guiders.
Added a semicolon (oops) so that the overlay is transparent in old versions of IE.

Scrolls the guider into view on show if needed

When using attachTo on a page with scroll, there's a risk of the guider getting displayed
outside of the viewport. This commit makes sure the window scrolls to center on the guider
in that case

Support jQuery with noConflict()

Don't assume the global $ exists and it's jQuery – pass jQuery as an argument and use $ internally only.
pass JSLint
optimizely.com relative -> absolute

Added the ability to automatically call a guider upon loading a URL with the guider id as a hash.  For example, you can use www.example.com/app#guider=first_id, which will load the first_id guider without using .show()
